abstract: Daniel L. Vasella, chief executive of Novartis, discusses the challenges facing the health care system.
snippet: Daniel L. Vasella, chief executive of Novartis, discusses the challenges facing the health care system.
lead_paragraph: Daniel L. Vasella, chief executive of Novartis, the $39 billion pharmaceutical giant based in Switzerland, says that even though Americans have made progress in curing some diseases, they face a major increase in obesity- and aging-related diseases. Mr. Vasella recently discussed these challenges and criticized the Food and Drug Administration in the United States for failing to act more quickly to approve new drugs.

headline.main: A Drug Maker’s Views of What Ails Health Care
